summary: The Department of Defense conducts background checks for over 4 million employees and contractors across the federal government. It finances the background checks by charging fees to other agencies through a working capital fund—a self-sustaining fund that breaks even over time. DOD must maintain a cash reserve in the fund to cover operational costs for the background checks. But it overestimated how much money it...
title: Personnel Vetting: DOD Should Improve Management and Operation of Its Background Investigation Working Capital Fund
